response: narrative=Francesca Ahmed (MP), a retired clinical scientist, was reported missing from her home on Argyll Road, Perth. Earlier that day, she had mentioned to her sister, Kelly Ahmed, her intention to visit the senior center to reminisce and engage in the knitting group. Kelly, unable to reach Francesca later, became concerned and contacted the authorities. A neighbor along Ferntower Road, Crieff, noted seeing Francesca confused and walking near 53 Cultybraggan Camp. Prompt action by the police led to her swift location at Dundurn Walk. She was unharmed and seemed disoriented due to her disability, possibly exacerbated by unfamiliar routes. Reunited with family, she was grateful for the assistance and vowed to inform loved ones of her whereabouts henceforth.

narrative=Francesca Ahmed was last known to have made a transaction at a rural shop on Atholl Street, Dunkeld. Friends and family mentioned her growing interest in a hermit lifestyle. Close relatives, including her sister, grew concerned when she did not return from a boating trip near Gleneagles, Auchterarder. The possible boating incident raised alarms, prompting a search. Francesca was eventually traced by police at Muirhall Road, Perth, having sought solitude.

Her brother expressed concern that she might have headed towards the library and pharmacy for errands as planned. Her friend, Jayne Chapman, later reported that Francesca was interested in a potential boating activity near Errichel in Aberfeldy, raising fears of a possible boating incident.

narrative=Francesca Ahmed, known for her interest in a hermit lifestyle, was reported missing from her residence on Argyll Road, Perth.
